textbooks.title: Artificial Intelligence in Practice: How 50 Successful Companies Used AI and Machine Learning to Solve Problems
textbooks.author: Marr, B. & Ward, M.

textbooks.title: Applied Artificial Intelligence: A Handbook for Business Leaders
textbooks.author: Yao, M., Zhou, A., and Jia, M.

topics: Face recognition: deploying, managing, and monitoring modern systems
Face recognition: assessing fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law
Autonomous transportation: deploying, managing, and monitoring modern systems
Autonomous transportation: assessing fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law
Machine translation: deploying, managing, and monitoring modern systems
Machine translation: assessing fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law
Fraud detection: deploying, managing, and monitoring modern systems
Fraud detection: assessing fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law

grading.policies: Late problem sets and projects will not be accepted unless excused in writing by the instructor.

policies.attendance: Attendance is required and is worth 1 point per class.
policies.late_work: Late problem sets and projects will not be accepted unless excused in writing by the instructor.
policies.academic_integrity: Students must uphold the ideals set forth in the Honor System Constitution.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: The course meets 14 times, divided into four 3-week units and one 2-week unit.
additional_info.technology_requirements: You will need a computer that can run Python 3.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: This course surveys applications of artificial intelligence to business and technology in the digital era.
learning_outcomes: Manage the performance of an AI system and monitor its ongoing effectiveness
Distinguish between hype and rapid advances in AI methods.
Assess AI systems along dimensions of fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law.
Develop strategy for deployment of AI solutions within an organization.
prerequisites: One advanced ML course (e.g., BIA 667 Deep Learning)
